he River Road was located in Huzuz, the City of Delights, in 1367 DR.
This road encircled Huzuz from the north. It approached Huzuz from the east and ran between the city and Al-Sarif River, meeting the South Road on both the east and west side of the city. The River Road was used heavily by caravans bound for the Ghosts Route,  as well as merchants unloading their cargo from the Trade Harbor. The River Road entered Huzuz from the north side where it ran to the Grand Bazaar in the Merchants District.
